headline: '100% of Addicts Eventually Have Financial Troubles' — Ramsey Tells 25-Year-Old Who Lost $55K Gambling To Do These Three Things
summary: Addiction can take hold with devastating speed, as one 25-year-old caller to "The Ramsey Show" found. James, a business owner with an annual income of about $120,000, told host Dave Ramsey how he lost between $45,000 and $55,000 in just six weeks to a sudden gambling habit after moving to Atlantic City. headline: Venture Funding Roars Back in Q3, Thanks to AI's Billion-Dollar Boom
summary: Gigantic investments of $500 million dollars or more into Artificial Intelligence companies led a 38 percent increase in year-over-year third quarter global venture capital funding. Year-over-year third quarter increases in other early-stage investment levels were more modest, however, according to Crunchbase.com. headline: Running On A Financial Treadmill: Why A $400 Per Month Raise Changed Nothing For This Worker
summary: A recent Reddit post captured the frustration felt by millions of workers in today’s economy: that Fred Flintstone-like feeling of running faster and faster just to stay in the same place. The post shared on the r/middleclassfinance subreddit, which netted over 2,000 upvotes and hundreds of comments, tells a tale that is both personal and universal.
